docs.lead_paragraph:
LAKELAND, Fla. — The Yankees announced they signed Chien-Ming Wang, their own former pitcher, to a minor league contract to provide pitching depth. He is scheduled to work out on Monday.
 
Wang, who will turn 33 on March 31, won 46 games for the Yankees from 2006 until June 15, 2008, when he injured his foot running the bases, the first in a string of injuries that derailed his Yankee career.

docs.snippet: Though men have been wearing their suits with running shoes and incorporating sweatshirts into work gear for a while now, the athletic look continues this spring. Miuccia Prada presented a collection of what seemed to be team uniforms for the futu...
docs.lead_paragraph:
Though men have been wearing their suits with running shoes and incorporating sweatshirts into work gear for a while now, the athletic look continues this spring. Miuccia Prada presented a collection of what seemed to be team uniforms for the future. Valentino, Bottega Veneta and Raf Simons showed the majority (if not all) of their looks with sneakers instead of proper oxfords. Some designers were even more specific with their sporty adaptions — as in the case of the young British designer Lou Dalton, who created this high-fashion take on a baseball shirt ($399; openingceremony.us ).
 
To be clear, these are not clothes meant for wearing on the field or court. Instead, worn a piece or two at a time, in muted tones (leave the neons at the gym), and paired with crisp shirts and neat trousers, they can add graphic interest to the most basic wardrobe. Raf Simons shirt, $430, and pants, $515; rafsimons.com .

docs.snippet: LAKELAND, Fla. — The growing sentiment around baseball takes a dim view of the Yankees’ chances in 2013, what with the losses of key players like Nick Swisher, Russell Martin and Rafael Soriano, plus injuries to Mark Teixeira, Curtis...
docs.lead_paragraph:
LAKELAND, Fla. — The growing sentiment around baseball takes a dim view of the Yankees’ chances in 2013, what with the losses of key players like Nick Swisher, Russell Martin and Rafael Soriano, plus injuries to Mark Teixeira, Curtis Granderson, Alex Rodriguez and Derek Jeter.
 
But Andy Pettitte, fresh off the mound after a mixed outing against the Detroit Tigers, declared that until someone takes the crown away, the Yankees are the defending American League East champions and expect to defend their title.
